text:
does anyone know how to iterate through references to `::Observable` in `JSServe.JSCode` blocks? I'm trying to do something like this
```x = [Observable(true),Observable(false)]
	
js"""
for(i=1;i<=$(length(x));i++) 
	console.log($(x[i]))
"""```
 `i` is not defined in Julia and hence in the reference `$(x[i])` errors out. But it is defined in the JavaScript block

elements.text: does anyone know how to iterate through references to
blocks? I'm trying to do something like this
is not defined in Julia and hence in the reference
errors out. But it is defined in the JavaScript block

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55323| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
<@U66SGEWAC> perhaps there is a docs example I am not aware of?

elements.text: perhaps there is a docs example I am not aware of?

text:
wow did not realise this was possible; ok answered my own question again :sweat_smile:
```$(x).map( i => console.log(i) )```

elements.text: wow did not realise this was possible; ok answered my own question again

text: Hey <@UMAJCM1DF>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
